subject: Photography
title: Lightroom and Batch Editing
description: Learn Lightroom and Batch Editing in one minute.

hook.text: A wedding photographer shoots 3,000 images. Editing them one by one in Photoshop would take weeks.

buildup.text: Lightroom launched in 2006 as a tool for managing and editing large volumes of photos efficiently.

discovery.text: Batch editing lets you apply the same adjustments to hundreds of images at once ‚Äî a workflow revolution.

twist.text: Lightroom's non-destructive editing never alters the original file. Every change is reversible, always.

climax.text: The combination of catalog management, RAW processing, and batch tools made Lightroom essential for professionals.

punchline.text: Photoshop edits one image deeply. Lightroom edits a thousand quickly.

quiz.question: What workflow problem did Lightroom solve for photographers?
options: Efficiently editing and managing large volumes of photos with batch tools
It replaced the need for cameras
It only works with JPEG files
